item.title: Easy Way To Market Yourself and Why You Should Do It - Tell Your Story Part 1 - The Futur
item.description:
How to market yourself to your audience? How can you establish yourself as a thought leader but still makes people like you? What is the best marketing strategy that you can use in long term?
All of that can be answered in just one phrase: Tell your story. But how and why you should tell your story. In this first episode, Chris will show you why telling your story is one of the best way you can do to make people know you, like you and trust you

item.title: Reinvent Yourself (2021)– Obstacles Are Opportunities In Disguise - The Futur
item.description:
How come some people are stuck and other are quick to change? How does someone get over obstacles? How do you bring all of your interests together to use as an advantage? How do you pivot?
In this talk from Graphika Manila 2021 you’ll hear Chris tell his story of how we was able to go from graphic design, motion design, and everything in between to going on youtube and teaching millions. He also shares how you can overcome obstacles and use them to your advantage.
00:00 - Start 1:25 - Agenda 1:40 - Part 1: Refusal Of The Call 3:56 - Part 2: The Mentor Appears 5:20 - Part 3: Crossing The Threshold 6:03 - Part 4: Trials 8:25 - Part 5: Outcome 9:23 - 2 stories of how people used obstacles to their advantage 12:48 - The O.R.E.O. Formula 12:58 - Part 6: Conclusion 25:33 - Resources
Resources: The Innovator's Dilemma - https://amzn.to/3qAyV70 The Good Enough Revolution - https://www.wired.com/2009/08/ff-goodenough/ The Dip - https://amzn.to/3qA8cHD The Obstacle Is The Way by Ryan Holiday - https://amzn.to/2OjIE4p The Compound Effect by Darren Hardy - https://amzn.to/3coA1gK Goals by Zig Ziglar - https://amzn.to/3vcGLXH Atomic Habits* by James Clear - https://amzn.to/3etLA95 Grit* by Angela Duckworth - https://amzn.to/3etZhoG Power of Self Confidence by Brian Tracy - https://amzn.to/3coAdfY The Checklist Manifesto* by Atul Gawande - https://amzn.to/3bxFXVJ *Highly recommended by friends

item.title: NASA Reestablishes Contact with the Voyager, Almost 12 Billion Miles from Earth! - TheSimplySpace
item.description:
44 years: That's how long it's been since the Voyager 2 space probe left our blue home planet to subsequently gain new insights into our galactic neighborhood in the endless expanses of space. During this time, NASA's unmanned spacecraft penetrated an incredible 12 billion miles into space and passed numerous planets of our solar system during its flight. While Voyager 2 has regularly sent important data to Earth over the past four and a half decades, the connection to the world-famous probe was severed for many months in March of last year. We will now reveal the reasons for this and how the experts of the renowned space agency finally managed to restore the signal to Voyager 2. However, before we get into this topic, we would like to take a look at the spacecraft’s history together with you. In today's video, you’ll find out which celestial bodies the probe has already visited during its decades-long flight, which galactic milestones have been recorded in the process and what the future of the venerable space vehicle looks like.
Subscribe for more! ► https://bit.ly/2Q64mGd
Credit: NASA, ESA, ESO, SpaceX, Wikipedia, Shutterstock, ...
#TheSimplySpaceEN
item.itunes:subtitle: by TheSimplySpace published on Thursday, July 8 2021 at 14:00:00

item.title: Especial análisis situación actual, con el Dr. Rafael Toledo - Radio El Respeto
item.description:
Rafael Toledo es Catedrático de Parasitología y profesor de Inmunología en la Universitat de València (UV). Durante el programa analizamos la situación actual de la pandemia en España, cubriendo temas como la subida de contagios, papel de la variante Delta, si este incremento de casos está impactando a nivel ingresos y fallecidos, inmunidad de grupo y vacunas.
El Dr. Toledo expone también su visión sobre las medidas que adoptó España durante el confinamiento, la estrategia de vacunación y lo que podemos esperar en el futuro próximo. ____________________________________________________________________________________________

item.description:

New Safari Tab Bar. Tab Groups. Tabs Anywhere. Everywhere even. Universal Control for iPad… and Mac. AirPlay to Mac. AirPlay Speaker…from Mac. Spatial Audio with heads tracked. Shortcuts on Mac. item.title: Vacunas y ADE - Radio El Respeto
item.description:
El ADE es un fenómeno que consiste en que los anticuerpos, en vez de combatir al virus, facilitan la infección y agravan la enfermedad. Algo así como si se aliaran con él. Es muy inusual, perose ha observado con el dengue y con el zika, con una de las candidatas a vacuna contra el VRS y el sarampión, pero siempre de detectó en los ensayos y se retiraron. En coronavirus anteriores se vio que si se usaba la proteína N, la vacuna era más propensa a provocar ADE, y esa es una de las razones por las que ahora se utiliza la proteína S. Gracias a eso, precisamente, toda esa información de esos coronavirus anteriores se ha utilizado en el desarrollo de estas vacunas. Se han puesto mil millones de dosis de vacunas en el mundo, y no se ha visto nada.
Esta es la opinión del Dr. Pepe Alcamí y del Dr. Luis Enjuanes (extractos de las entrevistas mantenida con ellos en el canal).
____________________________________________________________________________________________

item.title: Entrevista completa: "El Bill Gates español" #LaEstirpedelosLibres - Canal Iker Jiménez
item.description:
José Luis Domínguez es probablemente el hombre que más contribuyó a la implantación masiva de los ordenadores domésticos en España. Fue el fundador de la empresa Indescomp y el auténtico introductor de la marca Amstrad en nuestro país. A principios de los ochenta abandonó su trabajo como agente de seguros con la intención de vender microordenadores. Fue el fundador de Indescomp, una leyenda en la historia del software español gracias a los juegos 'La pulga' y 'Fred'.
Gracias al ordenador CPC 464 de la empresa Amstrad marcó un hito en la historia de la informática casera española. En Indescomp, a principios de los años 80 y bajo su batuta, se juntaron algunos de los mejores desarrolladores españoles. Casi todos los videojuegos que Indescomp desarrolló para Amstrad CPC fueron publicados bajo el sello de Amsoft, una subsidiaria de Amstrad. Desde 1985 hasta 1989 Indescomp publicó, bajo el nombre de Amstrad User, una revista dedicada exclusivamente a los usuarios de Amstrad en España.
item.itunes:subtitle: by Canal Iker Jiménez published on Tuesday, June 8 2021 at 22:26:50

item.title: Doja Cat - "Say So" Live | MTV EMA 2020
item.description:
Doja Cat brings an incredible rock rendition of her hit track 'Say So' at the MTV EMA 2020 in London!
The 2020 MTV EMAs are hosted by Little Mix and feature performances from Jack Harlow, Alicia Keys, Tate McRae, DaBaby, Karol G, David Guetta, Sam Smith, Maluma, Doja Cat, YUNGBLUD, Zara Larsson, Little Mix, Madison Beer, Why Don't We, and 24kGoldn.
#MTVEMA2020 #DojaCat

The 2020 MTV EMAs are hosted by Little Mix and feature performances from Jack Harlow, Alicia Keys, Tate McRae, DaBaby, Karol G, David Guetta, Sam Smith, Maluma, Doja Cat, YUNGBLUD, Zara Larsson, Little Mix, Madison Beer, Why Don't We, and 24kGoldn.

item.title: CS50 Lecture by Mark Zuckerberg - 7 December 2005
item.description:
On 7 December 2005, Mark Zuckerberg joined CS50 for a guest lecture about Facebook and computer science. With Professor Michael D. Smith. Shared with permission.
***
HOW TO SUBSCRIBE
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=cs50tv
HOW TO TAKE CS50
edX: https://cs50.edx.org/ Harvard Extension School: https://cs50.harvard.edu/extension Harvard Summer School: https://cs50.harvard.edu/summer OpenCourseWare: https://cs50.harvard.edu/x
HOW TO JOIN CS50 COMMUNITIES
Discord: https://discord.gg/T8QZqRx Ed: https://cs50.harvard.edu/x/ed Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/cs50/ Faceboook Page: https://www.facebook.com/cs50/ GitHub: https://github.com/cs50 Gitter: https://gitter.im/cs50/x Instagram: https://instagram.com/cs50 LinkedIn Group: https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7437240/ LinkedIn Page: https://www.linkedin.com/school/cs50/ Quora: https://www.quora.com/topic/CS50 Slack: https://cs50.edx.org/slack Snapchat: https://www.snapchat.com/add/cs50 Twitter: https://twitter.com/cs50 YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/cs50
HOW TO FOLLOW DAVID J. MALAN
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dmalan GitHub: https://github.com/dmalan Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/davidjmalan/ LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/malan/ Quora: https://www.quora.com/profile/David-J-Malan Twitter: https://twitter.com/davidjmalan
***
CS50 SHOP
https://cs50.harvardshop.com/
***
LICENSE

David J. Malan https://cs.harvard.edu/malan malan@harvard.edu
